ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Site
Clinic ID
Intervention Status
Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: Days since baseline
Medications are an important part of the treatment of anxiety.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Medication for anxiety does not help a person cope better.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Therapy can help an individual learn new ways of coping with problems.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Therapy patients are wasting money.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Taking my antipsychotic medication helps prevent getting hospitalized.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Moderately disagree; 3=Slightly disagree; 4=Neutral; 5=Slightly agree; 6=Moderately agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Side effects from my antipsychotic medication bother me.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Moderately disagree; 3=Slightly disagree; 4=Neutral; 5=Slightly agree; 6=Moderately agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Taking my antipsychotic medication is difficult to remember everyday.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Moderately disagree; 3=Slightly disagree; 4=Neutral; 5=Slightly agree; 6=Moderately agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I am supported by my family, friends and doctors to take my antipsychotic medication.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Moderately disagree; 3=Slightly disagree; 4=Neutral; 5=Slightly agree; 6=Moderately agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Full-Scale 4-Item Mean Total Score
Actual number of months from Baseline
How often do you think a typical person your age uses marijuana (weed, edibles, hash, hash oil)?
Notes: 0 = Never; 10 = Less than once per month; 25 = Once a month; 50 = 2 times per month; 75 = 3 times per month; 100 = Once a week; 200 = 2 times a week; 300 = 3 times a week; 400 = 4 times a week; 500 = 5 times a week; 600 = 6 times a week; 700 = Every day

ElementDescription: How many days do you think a typical person your age used marijuana in the past month?
How often do you use marijuana (weed, edibles, hash, hash oil?)
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Once a year; 2 = 2-5 times a year; 3 = Every other month; 4 = Once a month; 5 = 2-3 times a month; 6 = Once per week; 7 = More than once per week; 8 = Every other day; 9 = Every day

ElementDescription: How many days did you use marijuana during the past year?
How many days did you use marijuana during the past 3 months?
How many days did you use marijuana during the past month?
How often do you think a typical person your age uses marijuana (weed, edibles, hash, hash oil)?
Notes: 0=Never; 0.1=Less than once per month; 0.25=Once a month; 0.5=2 times per month; 0.75=3 times per month; 1=Once a week; 2=2 times a week; 3=3 times a week; 4=4 times a week; 5=5 times a week 6=6 times a week; 7=Every day
